page.title: 01GOUROCK AND GREENOCK
page.content: THE AREA COVERED BY THIS BLOCK CONSISTS OF CENTRAL AND EASTERN GOUROCK AND CENTRAL AND WESTERN GREENOCK. GOUROCK IS A SMALL TOWN WITH A POPULATION OF JUST OVER 11,000. IT STANDS ON THE SOUTH BANK OF THE RIVER CLYDE ABOUT 40KM WEST OF GLASGOW. IT WAS ONCE A TOURIST RESORT, BUT IS NOW BASICALLY A COMMUTER TOWN. ON ITS EASTERN EDGE IS THE MUCH LARGER TOWN OF GREENOCK WHICH HAS A POPULATION OF OVER 59,000. GREENOCK IS STILL VERY MUCH AN INDUSTRIAL TOWN. THE TRADITIONAL INDUSTRIES OF SHIPBUILDING AND SUGAR REFINING HAVE BEEN IN DECLINE FOR SOME TIME NOW, BUT HAVE PARTLY BEEN REPLACED BY THE ELECTRONICS INDUSTRY.
